00040 /*
00041  The object of the class RTPHeader only stores and returns information about RTP header.
00042  */
00043 class RTPHeader {
00044         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& str, RTPHeader head);
00045         static const int USED_RTP_VERSION = 2;
00046 public:
00047         RTPHeader();
00048         RTPHeader(char* data);
00049         virtual ~RTPHeader();
00050 
00051         static const quint32 SIZE_IN_BYTES = 12;
00052 
00053         ostream& toStream(ostream& os);
00054         string toString();
00055 
00056         //private:
00057         /* version 2 bits  - it is always set to the value 2, which is the current version of RTP */
00058         quint8 v;
00059         /* padding 1 bit - is set when the packet contains one or more additional padding octets at the end which are not part of the payload - for this project it should be set to zero */
00060         bool p;
00061         /* extension 1 bit - is set when the header is followed by exactly one header extension - for this project it should be zero */
00062         bool x;
00063         /* CSRC count 4 bits - contains the number of CSRC identifiers that follow the fixed header - for this project it should be zero*/
00064         quint8 cc;
00065 
00066         /* marker 1 bit - the interpretation of the marker is dependent on the payload type */
00067         bool m;
00068 
00069         /* payload type 7 bits - this field identifies the format of the RTP payload and determines its interpretation by the application - it should be value 5 or 6 */
00070         quint8 pt;
00071 
00072         /* sequence number 16 bits - the sequence number increments by one for each RTP data packet sent */
00073         quint16 sequenceNumber;
00074 
00075         /* timestamp 32 bits - the timestamp reflects the sampling instant of the first octet in the RTP data packet */
00076         quint32 timestamp;
00077 
00078         /* the SSRC synchronization source 32 bits - identifies the synchronization source */
00079         quint32 ssrc;
00080 
00081         /* counts how many times there was passing through zero for sequence number */
00082         quint8 sequenceNumberCycle;
00083 
00084 public:
00085         /* copying constructor */
00086         RTPHeader(const RTPHeader& another);
00087 
00088         /* RTPHeader all constructor */
00089         RTPHeader(quint8 _v, bool _p, bool _x, quint8 _cc, bool _m, quint8 _pt,
00090                         quint16 _sequenceNumber, quint32 _timestamp, quint32 _ssrc);
00091 
00092         /* RTP standard constructor */
00093         RTPHeader(SampleRate _sampleRate, quint16 _sequenceNumber,
00094                         quint32 _timestamp, quint32 _ssrc);
00095 
00096         /* RTP assignment operator */
00097         RTPHeader & operator=(const RTPHeader& another);
00098 
00099         /* change actual RTP header to new next packet */
00100         void nextRTPHeader(SampleRate _sampleRate);
00101 
00102         /* to generate appropriate sequenceNumber */
00103         static quint16 generateSequenceNumber();
00104 
00105         /* to generate appropriate timestamp */
00106         static quint32 generateTimestamp();
00107 
00108         /* to generate appropriate synchronization source identifier -- actually should be unique and conflicts should be resolved */
00109         static quint32 generateSSRC();
